bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Minutes of the annual Meeting of the Board of Managers, Walter Reed Memorial Association, Washington, D.C., November 19, 1953

div1.p: This document records a decision to republish the reports of Reed, Finlay, and others relating to the transmission of yellow fever via mosquitos. The minutes also list payments made to Blossom Reed and to various florists for Ireland's funeral flowers and for a wreath presented at the Camp Lazear dedication.

div1.head: Minutes of the annual Meeting of the Board of Managers, Walter Reed Memorial Association, Washington, D.C., November 19, 1953
div1.p:
ANNUAL MEETING, BOARD OF MANAGERS, WALTER REED MEMORIAL ASSOCIATION
Washington, D. C., November 19, 1953

The Board met at 10 A.M. in the Board Room, American Security and Trust Company, 15th
Street and Pennsylvania Avenue, Northwest, Washington, D. C.
Col. J. F. Siler, the President, called the meeting to order.

The following members were present: Maj. Gen. George E. Armstrong, Brig. Gen. George R.
Callender, Dr. Gilbert Grosvenor, Col. Joseph F. Siler, Mr. Hans W. Ireland and Brig. Gen.
Albert G. Love. Maj. Gen. C. R. Reynolds, Dr. Philip S. Hench, BrigMaj Gen. Paul H. Streit and
Dr. Fred L. Soper had written and expressed their regrets at being unable to attend. Our
beloved and honored fellow member, Brig. Gen. Frank R. Keefer, who had been ill in the
hospital, telephoned that he would be unable to attend. Although he is now recuperating in
his home, he felt it inadvisable to attend.

The minutes of the last meeting, November 20, 1952, had been mailed to all members. The
Secretary stated that the following correction and addition had been made in the retained
official copy of the minutes.

Subsequent to the date of the mailing of the minutes, Dr. Gilbert Grosvenor wrote that
his secretary, at his direction, had telephoned his regrets at being unable to attend.

Dr. Fred L. Soper also forwarded the following resolution that had been approved at the
meeting. “The Board of Managers, on learning from Dr. Soper of a purpose that Delta Omega,
the Honorary Professional Society in Public Health, republish in the same volume the most
significant reports of Carlos J. Finlay, Walter Reed and others relating to the theory of the
mosquito transmission of yellow fever and to the convincing demonstration of such transmission,
voted to commend such republication in the interest of making readily available to all
interested parties the literature on this subject.

In view of the fact that there were no additional suggestions for corrections or
amendments, it was moved and seconded that the reading of the minutes be dispensed with and
they be approved as recorded. The motion was carried unanimously.
The Treasurer submitted the following report which was approved.

row.cell:
Commission to American Security
and Trust Co.

Commission to American Security
and Trust Co.

funeral of Gen'l M.W. Ireland
